intro: Macrocentrum montanum, commonly known as the mountain macrocentrum, is a herbaceous plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to purple. Macrocentrum montanum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native habitat.
